descriptions.content: The former may be a pejorative term applied by others. Nub (433.2) uses the term sems tsam. Vairocana's Theg pa thag gcod pa'i 'khor lo uses the name of sems tsam. In this category we find the great "logicians" (pramāṇa) movement led by Dignāga (480-540) and Dharmakırti (600-650). Later, Tsongkhapa (tsong kha pa, 1357-1419) was famous for his merging of this movement with the Prāsaṅgika Mādhyamaka.
descriptions.title: An Overview of Cittamātra or Yogācāra
